event.title: GDG Tech Talks on Tensor Flow
event.description:
Developers,
Do you still remember the robot arm NEKONOTE, which is powered by #TensorFlow , in #io16 ? We've invited RT Corporation, the maker of NEKONOTE, to share about it.
Registration starts at 6pm
Happy Coding.﻿
event.location: G/F, Mayson Garden Building, 2C -2E Wing Hing Street, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong

event.title: GDG Meet-up and Tech Talks on Android 7.0
event.description:
Developers,
We are moving to a new location in our meet-up in September.
And as you know, Android 7.0 Nougat has been released. We will have a very short sharing about it.
Seats are very limited. RSVP ASAP. Registration is a MUST!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/gdg-meet-up-sep-2016-tickets-27457603431
Address: Oursky, Rm B, 10/F, Great Wall Factory Building, 11 Cheung Shun St, Cheung Sha Wan, Cheung Sha Wan﻿
event.location: Oursky Limited, Hong Kong

event.title: Google Developers Study Jams - Android for Beginners
event.description:
Developers,
We are arranging a 2 days study jam for programmers who wants to learn how to create a "Hello World" application on Android.
We will announce more information soon.
Requirement: Basic programming knowledge Bring your own laptop with Android Studio Installed
Host: GDG Hong Kong and CityU App Lab
Information: http://developerstudyjams.com/﻿

Android (6.0 !?), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Google Maps, Project Tango, and more.
Mark the date. More information is coming.﻿

event.title: GDG Hong Kong - Meet-up (May, 2014)
event.description: Hi all! Please join us for the "GDG Hong Kong Meet-up" event. This is the very first GDG event hosted at the Google Hong Kong office. There are three presentations on Android & Maps. Please refer to the event page below for details and registration!﻿
event.location: Google Hong Kong, Matheson Street, Hong Kong

event.title: Meeting the Google Glass Developer
event.description: Click the G+ event for details and reserve your seat! Topic: Software Devlopment for Google Glass XE17 Speaker: Mark Scheel Abstract: Mark will share content from his soon to be published book, Software Development for Google Glass XE17. He will talk about the history of Google Glass, his personal experience after a year as a Glass Explorer, considerations for the design and development of Glassware, and more.﻿
event.location: City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong

event.title: Google Developer Day at Cliftons
event.description: <p>e cordially invite you to join the FREE Google IO and technology session held by GDG (Google Developers Group),formerly called GTUG on 20 Jul, 2012 at Cliftons. During the seminar, Google experts will demonstrate to you how Google products keep anything and share anything. Agenda 13:30 Registration14:00 Google developer outreach program update 14:35 Google IO new release updates15:05 Google technology Update- Google Drive15:35 Tea break16:00 Google technology Update- Android16:35 Google technology Update - Sketch Up17:05 Q&A and Group Photo</p>
event.location: Hong Kong,China

event.title: GTUG Day 2011
event.description: <p>The world has moved to another horizon that’s entirely internet-based, mobile, social and open. Every business needs to prepare for it. Join us at Google Solution Day organised by <strong>GTUG (Google Technology User Group)</strong>, and you’ll get everything you need to lead your company into this next generation. Join us for this free, full day event at the Regal Kowloon Hotel on DECEMBER 1 ,2011. During the event, we will show you the latest Google developments in Android, Chrome, Google+, Cloud and more. Follow us at GTUG HK Website to stay up to date on news from the GTUG Hong Kong team.</p>
event.location: Hong Kong,China

event.title: HK GTUG 2nd Event in City University in Kowloon
event.location: Hong Kong,China

event.title: Hong kong Google Technology User Group (GTUG) Founding Event and Android Developer Lab
event.description: <p>Date: March 5th, 2010Time: 1:00PM - 5:00PMVenue: Clifton CentralEventtitle: Hong kong Google Technology User Group (GTUG) Founding Event andAndroid Developer LabEvent content:* Introduction of Hongkong GTUG - charter, organizer introduction;* Android Developer Lab- Introduction of Android SDK 2.1 features;- Code lab (hands-on coding) for Active Wallpaper and other Android applications;- Q&A with Google engineers by local developers for their application;- Local developer networking and collaboration;Speakers:* From Google China: Bill Luan, Program Manager & China Country Lead;* From Hongkong: Ricky Cheung and Felix Lio, Hong Kong GTUG managers;* From Google HQ in MtView, USA: Fred Chung, Tony Chan, and Jame Yum, Developer Advocators andhttp://hk.gtugs.org/</p>
event.location: Hong Kong,China
